result.execSummary:
The defendant ELIZABETH J MATTESON was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: -Sentences are to be consecutive to each other and any other sentence. Court grants the defendant 28 days of sentence credit. Court grants huber, out-of-county service and out-of-county travel.
-Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or call the Clerk of Courts Office (920-294-4142) to set-up a payment plan.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. ELIZABETH J MATTESON

defendant.name: MATTESON, ELIZABETH J
defendant.address: 571 Cty Rd A, C/O Green Lake County Jail, Green Lake, WI 54941

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
3:55 PM Defendant ELIZABETH J MATTESON in court, in custody.  Attorney Vicki C. Jobling in court for ELIZABETH J MATTESON. Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin.  Atty Jobling states the defendant will waive the preliminary hearing in 2022CF80. Defendant concurs. Court instructs the defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary examination. Defendant waives his/her right to a preliminary examination. Court finds probable cause. Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial. State files an information with the court and a copy to Atty Jobling. Attorney Jobling acknowledges receipt of the information and waives any reading. Atty Jobling enters a plea of No Contest on behalf of the defendant. Atty Jobling recites agreement - defendant will plea to count 1 in 2021CF134, striking the alcohol fine enhancer with jail, fine, costs, revocation, IID, AODA and DNA sample, count 2 will be dismissed and counts 3 & 4 will be dismissed and read-in and 2021TR576 will be dismissed. In 2022CF80 jail, costs and DNA sample. DA concurs. Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant. Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights. Court goes over the elements of each offense. Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty. Court instructs defendant regarding deportation. (If felony) Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions. 

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST. Court finds the plea is made knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently. Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea. Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 in 2021CF134 striking the alcohol enhancer, orders count 2 be dismissed outright and counts 3 & 4 be dismissed and read-in. In 2022CF80, court finds the defendant guilty as charged and orders 2021TR576 be dismissed. Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today. Sentencing statement by DA. Sentencing statement by Atty Jobling. Statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

2021CF134 (count 1)

-6 months county jail, consecutive to any other sentence. Sentence is to commence immediately. Court grants huber, out-of-county service and out-of-county travel. 
-$1400 fine plus costs. Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or call the Clerk of Courts Office (920-294-4142) to set-up a payment plan. 
-Blood Draw Fee - $50.00
-DL revocation - Lifetime
-IID - 36 months
-AODA (GL )
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample. 

2022CF80

-30 days county jail. Court grants huber, out-of-county service and out-of-county travel. 
-Court costs. Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or call the Clerk of Courts Office (920-294-4142) to set-up a payment plan. 
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample. 

Court grants the defendant 107 days of sentence credit, 28 days on 2022CF80 and 79 days on 2021CF134.
Sentences are to be consecutive to each other and to any other sentence.

Court adjourned at 4:19 PM
Defendant's Notice of Filing Sentencing Documents w/attachment

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Preliminary Hearing - Schedule or Waiver on May 10, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Second appearance on May 31, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:35 AM Defendant ELIZABETH J MATTESON in custody, in court.  Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant states she would like to have an attorney for the preliminary hearing. Def states she has counsel on her other case and would like to have her as counsel for this case as well - Atty Jobling is her court appointed attorney on her other case 21CF134. Def waives the time limits for the prelim. Court has no problem appointing Atty Jobling to this case if Atty Jobling is willing. Court schedules status of counsel for May 31, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Court Adjourned at 10:38 AM.
records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on April 26, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance. Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.

ADDRESS INFO for ELIZABETH J MATTESON
Current: 571 Cty Rd A, C/O Green Lake County Jail, Green Lake, WI 54941 United States  (Effective: 04-19-2022)
Prior: W5444 CTH FF, Kingston, WI 53939

Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance. Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.

1:10 PM Defendant ELIZABETH J MATTESON appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Michael Kapelis appeared by video for the defendant. Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant has no objection to holding this hearing by zoom. Atty Kapelis confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading and requests preliminary hearing. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count. DA Laspisa makes bond recommendation. Statement by Atty Kapelis regarding bond. Court sets bond at $5,000 cash bond and conditions of: Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance. Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department. Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing. Defendant does not waive the time limits. Court will set for Preliminary Hearing April 26, 2022 at 10:30 AM.

Court adjourned at 1:14 PM.
